reviews.review: It made me want to puke

There are few times when I am privileged enough to witness one of the greatest films ever made in theaters. I'm not old enough to have seen classics like The Godfather, Pulp Fiction, Apocalypse Now, 2001: A Space Odyssey, or Citizen Kane come out, but I had the privilege of watching The Emoji Movie opening night in theaters.
I had been planning to see it for months, buying all the merchandise I could get my hands on and counting down towards it glorious release date, July 28, which I now consider my birthday (it's the day I finally woke up and saw the light).
I actually saw it July 27th, the day before; my wife took the kids to see Dunkirk, but while they can have fun watching big explosions and airplane flights, I'll be stimulating my intellect with a truly mesmerizing and enhancing experience. 
This is one of my favorite films of all time. Scratch that, it is my favorite film of all time. No point in holding back. I see that not all my fellow colleagues agree with me, and that's fine; it took people a while to see the brilliance of 2001: A Space Odyssey, too. I pray to Gene every night. I love him. 
Amen.
Surprise surprise, it sucks. I have no idea how it even has a 42%
That was the best movie I've ever seen I really enjoyed it ??

There's no doubt that what T.J. Miller and his ensemble has created here marks the beginning of a new era in motion picture history. The impressionistic cinematography, elaborate character development and the consistent visual language is nothing less than astonishing.
A jaw dropping marvel of modern cinema, that will surely go down the history books alongside Citizen Kane, Casablanca and The Shawshank Redemption.
This movie... oh god... the only reason I'm giving it 5 stars is because I feel like it, and I can only do this ironically. This is the dumbest thing I've even done. ????

This was a very good movie in my opinion 5 stars, people were following a train and rating it 1 because they are being dicks riding every ones "meme train" thinking it's funny when this actually probably fucked Sony really hard, 5 stars.

Possibly the worst movie I have ever seen. Took out daughter to see this and from start to finish it was a dud. There is no comedy, not too much action, not much period. We thought there would be more song and dance to keep the kiddo engaged, but even she was bored.
This movie gave me existential despair. It is a perfect zero.
